page.title: 01Back shore at Ardwell
page.content: Part of an area designated by the Regional Council as having a high scenic value. The block is bisected into the sea and the land mass. The sea is the North Channel joining the atlantic Ocean with the Irish sea and separates by some 20 miles scotland and Ireland. A depth sounding due West from this block is charted at 149 fathoms. The land, bordered by a rocky coastline, is partly pastoral, undulating up to 400 ft and verdant given over in the main to dairy farming. Houses and farms are isolated but not remote and the population is sparse. Agricultural emphasis is given to grass production for silage hay and grazing. Some barley winter wheat nd potatoes are also grown. this coastal strip benefits from the effects of the Gulf Stream and gives mainly mild winters
